subject: Re: DataBase Testing

messageBody:
Something that helps me decide what I should and should not write
tests for....write the tests first. ;)

Also, I'd have to agree with the other posts, it looks like you're
writing a test for the database or the driver, which seems a little
silly.

However, if you are writing a test for a JDBC driver, then that's
another story. ;)

-Eric

--- In junit@y..., Sanjay Mantoor <sanjay.m@k...> wrote:
> I think you are testing the database software rather than your code.
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbr@d...]
> Sent: Thursday, November 14, 2002 5:17 AM
> To: junit@y...
> Subject: Re: [junit] DataBase Testing
>
> So said vivek srinivasan on 2002-11-13
>
> >Hi Junitians,
> >Thx for all the time and help in all my previous
> >queries.This is question i have for a database unit
> >testing.
> >I have created a table called FlightInfo and stored
> >data into it. What i need is to write a testcase to
> >check for a null condition.ie if a null value is
> >inserted into the database, it should "spit" out that
> >error!!
>
> I think you are testing the wrong thing. Do not test the JDBC driver
> implementation for the database product you're using.
>
> An exercise: write in words the situation you're trying to avoid by
adding
> error handling. Write in business terms, and not in programming
terms.
>
